head.supplied: Botanic Gardens ¶ April 19th 1866 ¶ Sir ¶ ¶ I have the honor to request that you will be pleased to sanction the expenditure of the sum of four hundred and thirty seven pounds thirteen shillings and ...

div.p: N66/3726, unit 181, VPRS 3991/P, inward registered correspondence, VA 475 Chief Secretary's Department, Public Record Office, Victoria.
MS written by E. Heyne and signed by M. Botanic Gardens

I have the honor to request that you will be pleased to sanction the expenditure of the sum of four hundred and thirty seven pounds thirteen shillings and two pence for Salaries and Wages for the month of February. And I further beg that you will be good enough to grant me an advance of a sum of five hundred and twenty five pounds Sterl. for defraying the expenses for Salaries and Wages for the next ensuing month.

div.p: I have the honor to be Sir
